alert.note: Alert for Harding; Quay; San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 27 at 2:50AM MDT until May 27 at 3:30AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM MDT FOR EAST CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL...SOUTHEASTERN HARDING AND NORTH CENTRAL QUAY COUNTIES... At 250 AM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 17 miles northwest of Ute Lake State Park, or 20 miles southeast of Mosquero, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central San Miguel, southeastern Harding and north central Quay Counties. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
